title: ISYS: metadata for wmv file has different values in different platforms
description:
xquery version "1.0-ml";
        let $doc:= xdmp:document-get("QA_HOME/testdata/isysmedia/media_welcome-to-newton.wmv",
                     <options xmlns="xdmp:document-get">
                     <format>binary</format>
                     </options>)
        return
        xdmp:document-filter($doc)

The metadata in Solaris for  this is:
<     <meta name="IsVBR" content="false, false, false, false, false, true"/>

The metadata in Linux and windows for this is:
>     <meta name="IsVBR" content="false, false, false, false, false, false"/>

The content should be the same in all the platforms.

changeHistory.comment:
Reported to Isys.

Bug 18142 - ISYS: metadata for wmv file has different values in different platforms
Scott Miller
Sent: 	Friday, July 06, 2012 9:49 AM
To: 	
Levi Reep [levi.reep@perceptivesoftware.com]
Attachments: 	
Hi, Levi--

Our QA turned up an odd bug extracting metadata from a .wmv file using 10.2.  On Windows and Linux,
it yields the following...

<head xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
  <meta name="content-type" content="video/x-ms-wmv"/>
  <meta name="filter-capabilities" content="text"/>
  <title>Welcome to Newton (Apple Computer, 1994)</title>
  <meta name="Artist" content="Apple Computer"/>
  <meta name="AspectRatioX" content="1"/>
  <meta name="AspectRatioY" content="1"/>
  <meta name="Bitrate" content="1610702kb/s"/>
  <meta name="Channels" content="0"/>
  <meta name="DeviceConformanceTemplate" content="L2, @, @, @, @"/>
  <meta name="Duration" content="00:24:35"/>
  <meta name="IsVBR" content="false, false, false, false, false, false"/>
  <meta name="Media_Type" content="Windows Media"/>
  <meta name="Sample_Rate" content="480Hz"/>
  <meta name="WM_WMADRCAverageReference" content="1972"/>
  <meta name="WM_WMADRCPeakReference" content="13682"/>
  <meta name="WMFSDKNeeded" content="0.0.0.0000"/>
  <meta name="WMFSDKVersion" content="10.00.00.3646"/>
  <meta name="size" content="187305563"/>
</head>

...but on Solaris, the IsVBR content is "false, false, false, false, false, true".  I don't
expect that's actually supposed to be different, right?

Unfortunately, the file is big--187 meg; what would be the right way to convey that to you?

    Thanks,
        --Scott
This isn't fixed in Isys 10.2 update 3m, the ML 6.0-2 candidate Isys version, so deferring.

Opened a case on perceptivesoftware
https://perceptivesoftware.secure.force.com/
Case ID: 00618016

It is more likely a bug in MarkLogic that has been fixed.
Without upgrading to the latest isys document filter, regression isys_media.xml that covers this test started to pass since 2013-03-08. 

Will upgrade isys filter later for other isys bugs. Close this bug since it has been fixed.
